gurmukhi: kwlkyqu BXo blI Apwrw ] kwlrwie ijin ngr inkwrw ]
transliteration: Kaalket(u) Bhayo Badoo Apaaraa|| Kaalraae Jin(i) Nagad Nikaaraa||
translation: Kalket was a mighty warrior, who drove out Kal Rai from his city.

gurmukhi: Bwj snOF dys qy gey ] qhI BUpjw ibAwhq Bey ]28]
transliteration: Bhaaj Sanaudh Des Te Gad|| Tahoo Bhoopjaa Biaahat Bhae||28||
translation: Kal Rai settled in the country named Sanaudh and married the king’s daughter.28.

gurmukhi: iqh qy puqR BXo jo Dwmw ] soFIrwie Drw iqih nwmw ]
transliteration: Tih Te Poutra Bhayo Jo Dhaamaa|| Sodhooraae Dharaa Tih(i) Naamaa||
translation: A son was born to him, who was named Sodhi Rai.

gurmukhi: vMs snOF qw idn qy QIAw ] prm pivqR pRK jU kIAw ]29]
transliteration: Vans Sanaudh Taa Din Te Thooaa|| Param Pavitra Purakh Joo Kooaa||29||
translation: Sodhi Rai was the founder of Sanaudh dynasty by the Will of the Supreme Purusha.29.

gurmukhi: qwN qy puqR pOqR hoie Awey ] qy soFI sB jgq khwey ]
transliteration: Taan Te Poutra Paoutra Hoe Aae|| Te Sodhoo Sabh Jagad Kahaae||
translation: His sons and grandsons were called sodhis.

gurmukhi: jg mY AiDk su Bey pRis`Dw ] idn idn iqn ky Dn kI biRDw ]30]
transliteration: Jag Mai Adhik Su Bhae Prasiddhaa|| Din Din Tin Ke Dhan Koo Briddhaa||30||
translation: They became very famous in the world and gradually prospered in wealth.30.

gurmukhi: rwj krq Bey ibibD pRkwrw ] dys dys ky jIq niRpwrw ]
transliteration: Raaj Karat Bhae Bibidh Prakaaraa|| Des Des Ke Jeet Nripaaraa||
translation: They ruled over the country in various ways and subdued kings of many countries.

gurmukhi: jhwN qhwN iqh Drm clwXo ] A`qR p`qR kh sIs FurwXo ]31]
transliteration: Jahaan Tahaan Tih Dharam Chalaayo|| Attra Pattra Kah Soos Dhuraayo||31||
translation: They extended their Dharma everywhere and had the royal canopy over their head.31.

gurmukhi: rwjsUA bhu bwrn kIey ] jIq jIq dysysÍr lIey ]
transliteration: Raajsooa Bahu Baaran Kooe|| Jeet Jeet Desesvar Looe||
translation: They performed Rajasu sacrifice several times declaring themselves as supreme rulers, after conquering kings of various countries.

gurmukhi: bwjmyD bhu bwrn kry ] skl klUK inj kul ky hry ]32]
transliteration: Baajmedh Bahu Baraan Dare|| Sakal Kaleekh Nij Kul Ke Dare||32||
translation: They performed Bajmedh-sacrifice (horse—sacrifice) several times, clearing their dynasty of all the blemishes.32.

gurmukhi: bhur bMs mY bFo ibKwDw ] myt n skw koaU iqNh swDw ]
transliteration: Bahur Bans Mai Badho Bikhaadhaa|| Met Na Sakaa Ko( i)  Tinh Saadhaa||
translation: After that there arose quarrels and differences within the dynasty, and none could set the things right.

gurmukhi: ibcry bIr bnYq AKMfl ] gih gih cly iBrn rn mMfl ]33]
transliteration: Bichre Boor Banait Akhanndal|| Gad(i) Gad(i) Chale Bhiran Ran Mandal||33||
translation: The great warriors and archers moved towards the battlefield for a fight.33.

gurmukhi: Dn Ar BUim purwqn bYrw ] ijn kw mUAw krq jg Gyrw ]
transliteration: Dhan Ar Bhoom(i) Puraatan Bairaa|| Jin Kaa Moonda Karat Jag Gheraa||
translation: The world hath perished after quarrel on wealth and property from very olden times.

gurmukhi: moh bwd AhMkwr pswrw ] kwm kRoD jIqw jg swrw ]34]
transliteration: Moh Baad Ahankaar Pasaaraa|| Kaam Krodh Jeetaa Jag Saaraa||34||
translation: The attachment, ego and infights spread widely and the world was conquered by lust and anger.34.
